posts.content:
D'Alessandro, what are you casting against that's gonna beat a SR38+d20?? Run, RUN NOW .. No wait, Stop READING. RUN!!!!! (just teasing).

OK, spell pen is good perhaps for spell swords (adds to your caster levels, as if you're casting as having more sorcerer than what you really are; why also it is spell swords concentrate on "no save" spells). When you're an epic sorcerer (especially 38 levels of it, Paladin for the armour, etc., monk for the skills), what you want is your spell foci which raises spell save DCs in your focused book; ah, nothing beats a nice Wail of the Banshee, with a high DC, where all enemies die (barring a fort save, and why you want your foci). That particular spell also doesn't have a somatic component to it, meaning casting failure from armor is ignored.

Suppose though if you're a spell-sword that more stills would be good, along with the spell pen feats, so as to punch area of effect no-save spells, but which take into consideration SR. Hope this helps.

Tyr

posts.content: Can you have Automatic Quicken and Automatic Still at the same time? I looked in the wiki, and couldn't find an answer. I was under the impression that you could have only one automatic metamagic type.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
AFAIK Quicken and Auto Quicken make you cast as if you were under the Haste spell. There is no cumulative effect on casting speed when you have both the Quicken/Auto Quicken feat and a Haste spell active.
Haste is even better since it takes a hasted caster to counterspell you when you are hasted, whereas quickened spells can be counterspelled normally.
Extended Haste will last more than 7,5 minutes for a level 38 sorc. So most people see no reason to take the Auto Quicken line of meta magic for arcane casters.

NWNWiki on Automatic quicken spell
So, guys, girls, how would you build Exalted Sorceress?
